docs.snippet: The following Foreign Service changes since June 11 were announced today by the State Department: Warden McK. Wilson of Indianapolls, Ind., First Secretary of Legation, at The Hague, to Genoa, Italy, as Consul General. John R. Putnam of Hood River,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The following Foreign Service changes since June 11 were announced today by the State Department: Warden McK. Wilson of Indianapolls, Ind., First Secretary of Legation, at The Hague, to Genoa, Italy, as Consul General. John R. Putnam of Hood River, Ore., Consul General at Genoa, to Florence as Consul General. Laurence W. Taylor of Bakersfield, Calif., Vice Consul at Copenhagen, to Strasbourg, France, as Vice Consul.

docs.snippet: A Presidential Palace spokesman announced today that the Cuban Government had agreed to the appointment of J. Butler Wright as United States Ambassador to Cuba to succeed the present envoy, Jefferson Caffery, who has been on leave from his post for...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Presidential Palace spokesman announced today that the Cuban Government had agreed to the appointment of J. Butler Wright as United States Ambassador to Cuba to succeed the present envoy, Jefferson Caffery, who has been on leave from his post for three months.
docs.abstract: Cuba approves apptmt as U S Amb; Wash silent; career; por

headline.main: WRIGHT APPROVED AS ENVOY TO CUBA; U. S. Minister to Czechoslovakia Acceptable to Havana, but Washington Is Silent OTHER SHIFTS REPORTED Caffery Is Believed Slated for Brazil, With Gibson Going to Belgium as Ambassador Washington Withholds Comment Sent to Opium Conference
